item.title: Donna add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Donna add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Donna add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I cannot speak well enough to be unintelligible." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Donna add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "My father used to say: Every bird is one bird, and every book is one book, and every bird and every book is one thing too, under the words and the feathers." He finished with a flourish, as though the meaning of this was self-evident." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Donna add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Nanny's philosophy of life was to do what seemed like a good idea at the time, and do it as hard as possible. It had never let her down." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Donna add a quote by Lisa Shearin
item.description: "Most girls get flowers or candy. I get a declaration of martial law." -- Lisa Shearin

item.title: Donna add a quote by Peter Hedges
item.description: "In a cement park across the street is this giant sculpture. It is a giant umbrella frame lying on its side. It's green. Stand under it, during a rainstorm, you'll still get wet - that's why it's art." -- Peter Hedges

item.title: Donna add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "Wickedness was like food: once you got started it was hard to stop; the gut expanded to take in more and more." -- John Updike

item.title: Donna add a quote by Gideon Defoe
item.description: "Here's your first problem," he said, pointing at a sentence. "'Religion is the opium of the people.' Well, I don't know about people, but I think you'll find that the opium of pirates is actual opium." -- Gideon Defoe

item.title: Donna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Donna add a quote by Ilona Andrews
item.description: "I've never created a riot before. I did cause a brawl at the last formal. A large number of young women there actually arrived with the expectation of seducing me into matrimony, and a couple of their mothers came to blows. It was hilariâ€”I mean, dreadful. Simply dreadful." -- Ilona Andrews

item.title: Donna add a quote by Matthew Stover
item.description: "It's not always easy to distinguish between existentialism and a bad mood." -- Matthew Stover

item.title: Donna add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "She was staring after me with an expression she probably would have said was thoughtful." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Donna add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "It's like you said the other day," said Adam. "You grow up readin' about pirates and cowboys and spacemen and stuff, and jus' when you think the world's full of amazin' things, they tell you it's really all dead whales and chopped-down forests and nucular waste hangin' about for millions of years. 'Snot worth growin' up for, if you ask my opinion." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Donna add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Some prices are just too high, no matter how much you may want the prize. The one thing you can't trade for your heart's desire is your heart." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Donna add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Donna add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Donna add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "Privilege is not in and of itself bad; what matters is what we do with privilege. I want to live in a world where all women have access to education, and all women can earn PhDâ€™s, if they so desire. Privilege does not have to be negative, but we have to share our resources and take direction about how to use our privilege in ways that empower those who lack it." -- bell hooks

item.title: Donna add a quote by FranÃ§oise Sagan
item.description: "I was thinking that I should be content to kiss him until the break of day. Bertrand ran out of kisses too soon; desire made them superfluous in his eyes. They were only a stage on the road to pleasure, not something inexhaustible and self-sufficient, as Luc had revealed them to me." -- FranÃ§oise Sagan

item.title: Donna add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Build a man a fire, and he'll be warm for a day. Set a man on fire, and he'll be warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Donna add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Thereâ€™s no point in believing in things that exist." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Donna add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "You get a wonderful view from the point of no return." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Donna add a quote by Jeff VanderMeer
item.description: "The effect of this cannot be understood without being there. The beauty of it cannot be understood, either, and when you see beauty in desolation it changes something inside you. Desolation tries to colonize you." -- Jeff VanderMeer
